intro: Pistolochia × budensis, commonly known as the hybrid yellow trumpet. It is a flowering plant in the family Loganiaceae, characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is a cross between Pistolochia lutea and Pistolochia paniculata, resulting in a hybrid with unique floral traits. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
